Why Tooling Is The Architectural Lie

Most organizations believe Azure scale is a tooling problem. If they buy the right CI/CD suite, the right monitoring stack, the right infrastructure-as-code framework, the chaos will stop. They are wrong. Scale fails as drift, queues, and “just this once”…

external.description: Most organizations believe Azure scale is a tooling problem. If they buy the right CI/CD suite, the right monitoring stack, the right infrastructure-as-code framework, the chaos will stop. They are wrong. Scale fails as drift, queues, and “just this once” exceptions that quietly turn into permanent backchannels. Tooling does not prevent entropy. It accelerates it. This episode lays out the operating model that survives growth, audits, and outages—not because it restricts teams, but because it makes intent enforceable.
external.title: Why Tooling Is The Architectural Lie

record.text: lmao, even Co Pilot will tell you the AI craze is bullshit

images.alt:
I work in IT and will be supporting CoPilot when it rolls out, so am still learning about how it works. The marketing simply does not match the reality, and even CoPilot knows it:

" Why the marketing feels misleading
AI is sold with phrases like:
• 	“Ask anything.”
• 	“Get answers instantly.”
• 	“Your AI researcher.”
• 	“Your AI assistant.”
Those phrases imply:
• 	depth
• 	accuracy
• 	verification
• 	investigation
But the underlying mechanism is:
• 	shallow
• 	snippet‑based
• 	limited
• 	non‑iterative
So the perception is “AI knows everything,”
but the reality is “AI knows whatever the search API gave it.”
You’re not wrong — that gap is real."

images.alt: "The killdeer stands alert on a patch of sunlit grass, its slender body angled slightly forward as if poised for motion. Its plumage is a striking contrast of earthy brown across the back and wings, crisp white underparts, and two bold black bands slicing across its chest like ceremonial sashes. A delicate white ring encircles its neck, while a vivid red ring around its dark eye gives the bird a look of fierce clarity — a sentinel in feathers. The background is bright, almost washed out, which throws the bird into sharp relief, like a figure stepping forward from myth. Every feather is etched with precision, and the killdeer’s long legs and upright posture lend it a dignified, almost heraldic presence. The image feels like a moment of stillness before flight — a sovereign pause in the open field." - Microsoft Copilot

Dreamy Reflections at Low Tide

This is a quick snap I took early in the morning at Gulfport, Mississippi. The two gulls are likely laughing gulls, and the larger bird is a great blue heron.

images.alt: "Three birds stand quietly on a sandbar surrounded by shallow, shimmering water — a tranquil coastal tableau rendered in soft light. Two of the birds are gulls, compact and pale, their bodies angled slightly as if mid-conversation. The third is a taller, more statuesque figure: a heron, with long legs and a graceful neck that curves like a question mark against the horizon. The water around them glows with reflected light, creating a silvery wash that blurs the boundary between earth and sky. There’s no wind, no urgency — just the quiet geometry of birds and water, each figure distinct yet part of a shared stillness. The heron’s posture is regal, the gulls companionable, and the whole scene feels like a moment borrowed from a longer rhythm — the tide’s breath, the birds’ pause, the day’s hush." - Microsoft Copilot

The bird’s crest rises like a crown, giving it a regal silhouette, while its black facial mask frames a stout orange beak — a sharp contrast that draws the eye. The tree is leafless, its branches thin and reaching, like ink strokes on a pale canvas. The cardinal’s posture is upright and alert, as if guarding a quiet winter realm. Light catches the texture of its feathers, revealing subtle gradations of red from deep crimson to fiery scarlet. The background fades into a gentle haze, allowing the cardinal to stand alone in sharp relief — a solitary ember in a quiet landscape." - Microsoft Copilot

record.text: GoogleやMetaとの比較では、異なる収益化モデルが見られ、ChatGPTのように高いユーザー意図を持つプラットフォームはより高いARPU（1ユーザーあたりの平均収益）を実現しやすいとしています。OpenAIの優秀なチームとユーザー数の増加予測は、相当な収益ポテンシャルを示唆していますが、GoogleやGeminiなどの競合他社の存在も成長に影響を与えるでしょう。著者はユーモラスに、広告に頼る現状はAGIがまだ遠い未来にあることの証拠であり、職の安定性を保証していると述べつつ、AIの発展に対して前向きな見方を示しています。 (2/2)

💡 Summary: 

著者は、OpenAIの衰退に関する最近の懸念は根拠がないと主張し、その堅実な財務状況や10兆ドル規模のIPOを目指す野心的な計画を強調しています。AIの進歩にもかかわらず、収益の焦点は真の汎用人工知能（AGI）ではなく、広告主導の収益に留まっています。OpenAIは急速に成長しており、数百万人のユーザーと大きな収益目標を掲げており、ChatGPTに広告を導入して大量のユーザー基盤を収益化しようとしています。今後の戦略には、スポンサー付き広告や会話型広告、セルフサービス型プラットフォームの展開が含まれ、2029年までに数十億ドルの収益を目指しています。 (1/2)

Die https://Technikwoche.de von https://eicker.TV mit allen Kurzvideos an einem Stück und als YouTube Podcast:

Strategie gegen den Größenwahn 🧠 #Anthropic setzt bewusst auf #Effizienz statt auf den massiven Ausbau von Rechenzentren und positioniert sich damit als Gegenentwurf zur dominierenden „Scale um jeden Preis“-Logik der KI-Branche.

Regulatorischer Druck 🎭 #Meta hat laut internen Dokumenten gezielt die Darstellung von #Betrugsanzeigen in öffentlichen Werbe-Tools angepasst, um #Aufsichtsbehörden weniger problematische Inhalte zu zeigen, ohne das Grundproblem vollständig zu lösen.

Neues Datenschutz-Tool 🛡️ #Kalifornien hat mit #DROP eine kostenlose Plattform gestartet, über die Bürger.innen mit einem einzigen Antrag die #Löschung ihrer #Daten bei mehr als 500 registrierten #Datenhändler|n verlangen können.

Rubin startet die nächste AI-Ära 🚀 #Nvidia hat auf der CES mit #Rubin eine neue #ChipArchitektur vorgestellt, die laut CEO Jensen Huang bereits in Produktion ist und die rasant wachsenden Rechenanforderungen von #KI adressiert.

Kurzfristiger KI-Druck 🤯 #Apple soll laut Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo vor der #WWDC 2026 unter Zugzwang stehen und setzt deshalb vorübergehend auf ein #KIDeal Setup mit #Google, um schnell glaubwürdig liefern zu können.

Neuer Kurs bei Grok 🛡️ #XTwitter stoppt das Bearbeiten echter Fotos in „freizügige“ Outfits wie Bikinis und setzt wohl technische Sperren für alle Nutzer um.

Turbo-Ausbau 🚁 #Wing (Alphabet) weitet seinen #Drohnen #Lieferservice auf weitere 150 #Walmart Filialen aus und will damit den Sprung von regionalen Piloten zur #Massenlogistik schaffen.

record.text: Langzeitstudie: Social Media ist mies für Teens und Gaming ist noch schlimmer, oder? ▹ eicker.TV #eickerTV #Technews #Tech

external.description:
Social Media ist richtig mies für Teens und Gaming ist noch viel schlimmer.

Digitale Panik, wackelige Fakten 📉 Ein #LangzeitTracking mit über 25.000 #Jugendliche|n aus Greater #Manchester findet kaum Belege dafür, dass mehr #SocialMedia Zeit oder häufigeres #Gaming später Angst, Sorgen oder depressive Stimmung verursacht.

Besser als Momentaufnahmen 🔬 Statt nur “Vielnutzer vs. Wenignutzer” zu vergleichen, schaut die #Studie, was passiert, wenn dieselbe Person plötzlich mehr nutzt als sonst und genau dann bricht der vermeintliche Effekt weitgehend weg.

Aktiv oder passiv ist nicht der Hebel 📱 Auch das beliebte Narrativ “Posten ist okay, Scrollen macht krank” trägt hier nicht: Weder aktives noch passives Social-Media-Verhalten sagt spätere Probleme zuverlässig voraus.

Spannende Unterschiede nach Geschlecht 🎮 Bei Mädchen deutet sich an: mehr Gaming in einem Jahr, weniger Social Media im nächsten; bei Jungen gilt eher: mehr innere Belastung, weniger Gaming später, als würde die Lust am Hobby wegbrechen.

Risiken bleiben real, aber anders ⚠️ Cybermobbing, Schlaf, schädliche Inhalte sind weiter ernst, doch pauschale Stundenlimits oder Verbote wirken laut Studie langfristig wohl kaum und lenken von den echten Ursachen im Alltag ab.

👉 eicker.TV ▹ / Tech / Media / Politik / Business ⏻ eicker.BEratung von Gerrit Eicker aus Münster

external.description:
Eier per Drohne und das in wenigen Minuten!

Turbo-Ausbau 🚁 #Wing (Alphabet) weitet seinen #Drohnen #Lieferservice auf weitere 150 #Walmart Filialen aus und will damit den Sprung von regionalen Piloten zur #Massenlogistik schaffen.

So läuft’s 🗺️ Ausgehend von Dallas-Fort Worth und Atlanta startet die nächste Welle 2026 (u.a. Houston ab 15. Januar) und zieht sich bis 2027, am Ende sollen 270+ Walmart-Standorte rund 10% der US-Bevölkerung erreichen.

Was Leute wirklich bestellen 🛒 Die Power-User (Top 25%) bestellen laut Wing dreimal pro Woche, besonders oft Basics wie Eier, Hackfleisch und Tomaten, dazu Snacks und „brauch ich sofort“-Einkäufe.

Warum Walmart der Hebel ist 🤝 Statt überall eigene Infrastruktur aufzubauen, dockt Wing direkt an Walmart-Standorte an, integriert Prozesse vor Ort und skaliert über Standort-Cluster, damit Volumen die Wirtschaftlichkeit trägt.

external.description: The Bluesky post you linked from Bill Kristol (which mirrors his identical post on X) is a brief opinion statement reacting to a recent announcement from President Donald Trump. Kristol's phrasing—"A terrible day" and "The U.S. government vs. the free world"—is subjective and not verifiable as objectively true or false; it's his personal assessment of the situation. However, the underlying event he's referencing is Trump's January 17, 2026, announcement imposing tariffs on eight European countries to pressure Denmark into selling Greenland to the U.S. This announcement is factual and widely reported by credible news outlets. The tariffs (starting at 10% on February 1, 2026, and escalating to 25% on June 1, 2026) target Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Finland, and will remain until a deal is reached for the "complete and total purchase" of Greenland.  To address your question more directly, I'll break down the key claims from Trump's announcement (which appears to be the core of what Kristol is critiquing) and evaluate their truthfulness based on available evidence. I've categorized them for clarity, noting where claims are factual, exaggerated/misleading, false, or opinion-based.  Factual Claims (True or Mostly True) U.S. historical interest in purchasing Greenland: True. The U.S. has attempted or explored buying Greenland multiple times. In 1867, Secretary of State William Seward considered it after the Alaska purchase but didn't make a formal offer. In 1946, President Harry Truman formally offered Denmark $100 million, which was rejected (leading instead to defense agreements allowing U.S. bases like Thule Air Base). Trump himself publicly floated the idea in 2019, calling it a "large real estate deal," though Denmark dismissed it. China and Russia want Greenland: Mostly true, in a strategic sense. Both countries have shown significant interest in the Arctic region, including Greenland, due to its mineral resources (e.g., rare earth metals), melting ice opening new shipping routes, and military potential. China has invested in Greenlandic mining projects and research stations as part of its "Polar Silk Road" initiative. Russia has expanded its Arctic military presence and claims. However, neither has publicly expressed intent to "take" or buy Greenland outright—it's more about influence and economic footholds. Tariffs will be imposed as described: True (as an announcement). As president, Trump has the authority to impose such tariffs under trade laws like Section 232 or 301 of the Trade Act. The specifics—10% starting February 1, escalating to 25% on June 1, applied to all goods from the listed countries until a Greenland deal is reached—match what's reported across sources. European leaders have condemned it as "blackmail" and vowed a unified response, potentially including retaliatory tariffs. U.S. openness to negotiation: True, as stated. The announcement explicitly invites talks with Denmark or the other countries.  Exaggerated or Misleading Claims U.S. has "subsidized" Denmark and EU countries for years without tariffs or remuneration: Misleading. The U.S. doesn't provide direct financial subsidies to these countries. Trump is likely referring to the U.S. bearing a disproportionate share of NATO defense spending (about 3.5% of GDP vs. many allies below the 2% target), which he has long framed as a "subsidy." While the U.S. does fund military bases (e.g., Thule in Greenland) and alliances that benefit Europe, this isn't equivalent to cash handouts—it's mutual security cooperation. No tariffs have been absent because of free trade agreements like those under the WTO. Countries (Denmark, Norway, etc.) have "journeyed to Greenland for purposes unknown": Exaggerated/misleading. Leaders and officials from these nations have visited Greenland for legitimate reasons, such as climate research, diplomatic summits, or economic talks (e.g., EU interest in Arctic resources). Framing it as "unknown" or sinister implies conspiracy without evidence; visits are often public and tied to environmental or scientific cooperation. Need to acquire Greenland for "The Dome" and weapons systems, with hundreds of billions spent: Exaggerated/misleading. There's no publicly known U.S. program called "The Dome." This may be a loose reference to missile defense systems like Israel's Iron Dome (which the U.S. funds) or the radar "domes" at Thule Air Base, part of the U.S. Ballistic Missile Early Warning System. The U.S. has spent billions upgrading Thule for missile detection (protecting North America, including Canada), but not "hundreds of billions" specifically for this, and Greenland's inclusion isn't required for maximum efficiency—the U.S. already operates there under a 1951 defense treaty with Denmark. The "angles, metes, and bounds" phrasing (a real estate term) seems rhetorical rather than technical. Denmark's protection of Greenland is just "two dogsleds, one added recently": Exaggerated. Denmark's Sirius Dog Sled Patrol is a real elite unit that uses dogsleds to patrol Greenland's vast, remote areas—but it's not their only defense. Denmark maintains a small military presence, and the U.S. handles much of the strategic defense via Thule. This claim mocks Denmark's capabilities for effect.  False or Unsubstantiated Claims These actions are necessary because "world peace is at stake" and the situation endangers the "safety, security, and survival of our planet": False/unsubstantiated. While Greenland has strategic value (e.g., for Arctic monitoring and resources amid climate change), there's no evidence of an imminent threat to global peace from not owning it outright. The U.S. already has access via treaties, and no intelligence reports suggest China or Russia are poised to seize it. This is hyperbolic rhetoric to justify the tariffs. "Nobody will touch this sacred piece of Land" under U.S. control: Unsubstantiated/opinion. Greenland isn't "sacred" in any official sense, and control isn't contested militarily. This is motivational language without basis.  Opinion-Based Statements (Neither True nor False) Only the U.S. under Trump can "play in this game" successfully: Pure opinion, reflecting Trump's self-promotion. These countries are "playing a very dangerous game" with untenable risks: Subjective framing of trade and diplomacy as a "game." Many presidents have tried, and now is the time due to national security: Opinion on timing, though the historical attempts are factual.  Overall, the core event (Trump's tariff announcement to force a Greenland purchase) is verifiably true and has sparked international backlash, aligning with Kristol's view of it as U.S. antagonism toward allies. However, many of Trump's justifications mix facts with exaggeration to build his case. If you meant a specific part of the post or have more context, feel free to clarify!

record.text: I'm not trying to make a hyper-comprehensive thread here, I'm just trying to explain this one concept in a simple way for people who have just never really contemplated it before. Most people never want to think about this.

You may hear other arguments against them too but imo this is the key one to understand.

Also, for these AIs to be able to spit out these photo-realistic images of kids being abused, what were they trained on? I think it's fair to assume that every grok image of this nature is fueled by images of real victims, just like when it produces photo-realistic images of human gore.

images.alt:
Disabled, disinclined to marry, and more interested in writing than a lucrative career in medicine or law, Zelu has always felt like the outcast of her large Nigerian family. Then her life is upended when, in the middle of her sister’s lavish Caribbean wedding, she’s unceremoniously fired from her university job and, to add insult to injury, her novel is rejected by yet another publisher. With her career and dreams crushed in one fell swoop, she decides to write something just for herself. What comes out is nothing like the quiet, literary novels that have so far peppered her unremarkable career. It’s a far-future epic where androids and AI wage war in the grown-over ruins of human civilization. She calls it Rusted Robots.

When Zelu finds the courage to share her strange novel, she does not realize she is about to embark on a life-altering journey—one that will catapult her into literary stardom, but also perhaps obliterate everything her book was meant to be. From Chicago t

images.alt:
When COVID-19 sweeps through New York City, Jamie Gray is stuck as a dead-end driver for food delivery apps. That is, until Jamie makes a delivery to an old acquaintance, Tom, who works at what he calls “an animal rights organization.” Tom’s team needs a last-minute grunt to handle things on their next field visit. Jamie, eager to do anything, immediately signs on.

What Tom doesn't tell Jamie is that the animals his team cares for are not here on Earth. Not our Earth, at least. In an alternate dimension, massive dinosaur-like creatures named Kaiju roam a warm, human-free world. They're the universe's largest and most dangerous panda and they're in trouble.

It's not just the Kaiju Preservation Society who have found their way to the alternate world. Others have, too. And their carelessness could cause millions back on our Earth to die.

The Kaiju Preservation Society is John Scalzi's first standalone adventure since the conclusion of his New York Times bestselling Interdep

images.alt:
A war is brewing in Lyra's world between those who would keep people in ignorance and those willing to fight for freedom. Lyra is thrust into the middle of the conflict when her uncle Asriel comes to Oxford, fomenting rebellion, and when her best friend, Roger, suddenly disappears.

Lyra learns that Roger was kidnapped by a shadowy organization that is rumored to experiment on children. To find him, she will travel to the cold, far North, where armored bears and witch clans rule—and where Asriel is attempting to build a bridge to a parallel world.

What Lyra doesn’t know is that to help one of them will be to betray the other—and that her actions will have consequences not just in her world, but in all the worlds beyond.

Look for the modern fantasy classics of HIS DARK MATERIALS:
The Golden Compass. The Subtle Knife. The Amber Spyglass

And Lyra’s adventures continue in THE BOOK OF DUST:
La Belle Sauvage. The Secret Commonwealth. The Rose Field

DON’T MISS THE EP

external.description: クリスタル PalaceはOliver Glasnerの解任を決定しなかった。グレースナーは会長を含む幹部がキャプテンのマーク・ゲーイをサンダーランド戦の24時間前にマンチェスター・シティへ売却したと告発し、クラブの陣内に見捨てられていると非難した。解任の可能性が取り沙汰される中、Glasnerは契約満了まで残る意向を示し、今季限りでの退任を正式に表明している。これを受けてパリッシュ会長は、ゲーイの移籍がクラブの移籍戦略に影響を与えた事実を認識しつつ、シーズン終了まで指揮を執らせたい意向を示した。グレースナーは最近の2つの記者会見で、クラブの転換期における不満を公に表明し、ウィークス間の10戦未勝利の連続を受け「12～13人分の選手で戦っている」などと語り、板挟み状態を強調した。ゲーイの移籍は、契約満了が近づく選手の放出を回避するための決断だったとされ、ゲーイは日曜にマンチェスターでメディカルを受け、移籍は成立間近と伝えられる。なおジェアン・フィリップ・マテタの獲得交渉は続いており、ジュヴェントスはローン契約に義務付けた形での恒久化を望んでいる。クラブは19歳フォワード Sidiki Cherif の移籍交渉も進行中で、カナダ代表ストライカーのジョナサン・デイビッドを含めたオプション提示も検討されたが、デイビッドは移籍先として南ロンドンを希望していないとの情報もある。

【速報】英政府がヒルズボロ法改正案を撤回　遺族反発で再協議へ - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description: イングランド北西部ヒルズボロでの惨事を受けた政府提案の「ヒルズボロ法」関連修正案が、内容の後退を懸念する遺族団体や議員らの反発を受けて撤回された。 同法の基盤となる「パブリック・オフィス（アカウンタビリティ）法案」は、大規模災害後に公職者や公共契約者が真実を開示する義務を課すことを目的としている。 政府は水曜日に提出した修正案で、情報機関のスパイも対象に含める一方、その開示可否を各機関トップの裁量に委ねる内容を盛り込んでいた。 しかし活動家らは、これでは治安・情報機関の上層部が開示の是非を事実上決定し、透明性が損なわれると強く批判した。 その結果、政府は月曜日の段階で同修正案を採決にかけず、今後は遺族やキャンペーン団体と協議しながら上院審議の段階で新たな修正案を提示する方針だとみられている。

【速報】アフリカ・ネイションズカップ決勝！モロッコ不変の布陣vsセネガル3人入れ替え - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description: アフリカ・ネイションズカップ決勝を前に、モロッコとセネガルの両チームの先発メンバーが発表された。 モロッコは準決勝ナイジェリア戦と同じメンバーを維持し、安定した布陣で臨む。 一方セネガルはクリピン・ディアッタを外し、出場停止のカリドゥ・クリバリとハビブ・ディアッラの代わりにラミン・カマラ、アントワン・メンディ、ママドゥ・サールを起用して3人を入れ替えた。 セネガルは4-3-3のシステムでエドゥアール・メンディがゴールを守り、攻撃陣にはイドリッサ・ゲイェ、ニアカテ、マネらが並ぶ。 モロッコは4-1-4-1の布陣でボノがゴールマウスを守り、ハキミ、エル・カビらが中心となる。 審判はコンゴ民主共和国出身のジャン・ジャック・ンガンボ・ンダラが務める。 今大会は好条件の下、順当に強豪が勝ち進む傾向にあり、番狂わせは少ない。 北アフリカ最強のモロッコとサハラ以南アフリカ最強のセネガルによる決勝だけが、予想通りの展開を記憶に残る大会へと変える最後の機会となる。

Auf dem offiziellen X-Account der Anime-Umsetzung »Inherit the Winds« wurden heute zwei weitere Mitglieder des japanischen Sprechercasts offiziell vorgestellt. Die Anime-Adaption startet im Laufe des Jahres 2026 im japanischen TV.

🎙️Charaktere & Cast (Japanisch)
»Toshizo Hijikata« (Vizekommandant der Mibu Rōshigumi) von Koki Uchiyama
»Isami Kondo« (Kommandant der Mibu Rōshigumi) von Yuichi Nakamura

📜 Beschreibung 》
Im Juni 1863 wird ein Mann ohne Erinnerungen nach Kyoto gebracht und im Hauptquartier der Mibu Rōshigumi aufgenommen. Der Vizekommandant Soji Okita gibt ihm den Namen Jinsuke Tachikawa, und er beginnt ein neues Leben als Mitglied der Einheit. Während die Mibu Rōshigumi — später als Shinsengumi bekannt — im Chaos der späten Edo-Zeit zunehmend an Einfluss gewinnen, wird Jinsuke gemeinsam mit seinen Kameraden in die politischen und militärischen Umwälzungen der Epoche hineingezogen. Als er schließlich seine verlorenen Erinnerungen zurückerlangt, erkennt er, dass sich nicht nur seine Vergangenheit, sondern auch die Welt um ihn herum unwiderruflich verändert hat.

images.alt:
Kurz bevor die zweite Staffel am 24. Januar bei Disney+ im Simulcast startet, wurde auf der offiziellen Website von »Medalist« eine Fortsetzung in Form eines Anime Film angekündigt. Dieser soll nach aktueller Planung 2027 in den japanischen Kinos erscheinen. Weitere Informationen zur Produktion stehen derzeit noch aus. Außerdem wurde ein neues Key-Visual zur zweiten Staffel veröffentlicht. 

📜 Beschreibung 》
Inori Yuizuki und ihr Coach Tsukasa Akeura teilen denselben Traum: als „Spielerin und Trainer“ gemeinsam zum Sieg zu laufen und eines Tages ganz oben auf dem Podest als Medaillengewinner zu stehen. Nach Erfolgen beim Meiko Cup und der Westjapan-Schülermeisterschaft sowie bestandenen Badgetests darf Inori nun endlich in derselben Klasse antreten wie Wunderkind Hikari Okamizaki. Das nächste große Ziel ist der Chubu Block Wettkampf, bei dem es um die Qualifikation für die All Japan Championships geht. Zwischen neuen Rivalinnen, steigender Nervosität und immer schwierigeren Programmen will Inori beweisen, dass sie auf dem Eis die hellste von allen sein kann.
